@edoardocomar, can you verify that this works for you?

@dhwanikatagade, is it worth adding a note to the "Building IDE" section in the readme?
Merged to trunk after a minor tweak.

Hi @ijuma seen your request, I had just retested it from scratch. 

The generated eclipse projects work way better than what we had, huge improvements. Even the core project has the nested sourcepaths correct to run unit tests.

the only issue I get is a compilation error in streams
```
Description	Resource	Path	Location	Type
Type mismatch: cannot convert from KeyValue<capture#27-of ? extends K1,V> to KeyValue<K1,V>	KStreamImpl.java	/streams/src/main/java/org/apache/kafka/streams/kstream/internals	line 145	Java Problem
```
curious what that is

About `final`: it's (1) a hint for programmers not to change stuff and if they want to, to think twice about it and (2) the compiler can exploit `final` to generate more efficient code (also JIT compiler).
added the last final, the more you know i guess.  i learned some java today!

@guozhangwang Call for final review and merge (maybe also `0.10.2` before the next RC gets cut?)
\cc @ewencp

Where is the version for `{{version}}` coming from? And are we definitely always rendering this? I tried rebuilding site-docs with this and copying it over to `0102/` and it's just linking to URLs with `{{version}}` in them...

Hmm, perhaps the issue is that for some files the `.html` file hasn't been changed to something like `<script id="design-template" type="text/x-handlebars-template">` so we are not applying the template parameters? @derrickdoo is that right?

https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.11/1580/
Test PASSed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.11).

@ewencp {{version}} is coming from /docs/js/templateData.js that gets loaded on top of all the main "root files" (files that are used to serve up entire page layouts). 

Right now there's just 3 root files for docs (this may expand over time):
1. /[version]/documentation.html
2. /[version]/streams.html
3. /[version]/quickstart.html

All of these root files when used on kafka-site, load up a partial "/includes/_footer.htm" which runs through the file and swaps in the context variables from "templateData.js". Since there's a different copy of templateData.js for every version of our docs, each version gets the right stuff swapped in.

Note:
To support legacy URLs out there for kafka-site, (quickstart.html) is technically is used as a partial for the path "/documentation" (served by /[version]/documentation.html) as well as being it's own page for the path "/introduction" (served by /introduction.html). This isn't really important - just in case you were wondering why that file is slightly different.

@ewencp and yes to answer your other question if you don't see that script tag on the page, then it's definitely not going to do the replacement logic (sorry if I missed stuff). Here's the pages that are currently setup:

/docs/introduction.html
/docs/implemenation.html
/docs/design.html
/docs/api.html
/docs/configuration.html
/docs/ops.html
/docs/security.html
/docs/connect.html
/docs/streams.html
/docs/quickstart.html
Thanks for that!
